# Intro/Overview

# Setting Up

## Loading Libraries


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse) # who doesn't want to be tidy?
library(gt) # for nice tables
library(sf) # for handling geo data
library(here) # reproducible file paths
library(htmltools) # making html labels
library(htmlwidgets) # saving final map
library(leafpop) # pop-up with images
library(leaflet) # mapping
```
:::


## Loading Data

Reading in the data.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
 retractions <- read_csv("retractions.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
Rows: 47024 Columns: 21
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (18): Title, Subject, Institution, Journal, Publisher, Country, Author, ...
dbl  (3): Record ID, RetractionPubMedID, OriginalPaperPubMedID

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```
:::
:::


By publisher


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
retractions %>% group_by(Publisher) %>% count(sort = TRUE) %>% head()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 × 2
# Groups:   Publisher [6]
  Publisher                                                   n
  <chr>                                                   <int>
1 IEEE: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers 10088
2 Elsevier                                                 5496
3 Springer                                                 4272
4 Wiley                                                    2840
5 Hindawi                                                  2030
6 Taylor and Francis                                       1401
```
:::
:::


# Conclusions
